# Error Handling

## Goal

Establish a consistent error response format across all API endpoints.

## Convention

| Rule | Implementation |
|------|----------------|
| Error responses use JSON | `res.status(code).json({ error: message })` |
| HTTP status codes are semantic | 401 for auth, 404 for not found |
| Error field is always `error` | Single string message |

## Applies To

| Component | How Applied |
|-----------|-------------|
| c3-102 Auth Middleware | Returns `{ error: 'No token provided' }` or `{ error: 'Invalid token' }` |
| c3-103 Users Router | Returns `{ error: 'User not found' }` |
| c3-104 Products Router | Returns `{ error: 'Product not found' }` |

## Examples

```typescript
// 401 Unauthorized
res.status(401).json({ error: 'No token provided' });

// 404 Not Found
res.status(404).json({ error: 'User not found' });
```

## Testing

| Scenario | Expected |
|----------|----------|
| Missing auth token | 401 with error message |
| Invalid resource ID | 404 with error message |

## Source Files

- `src/middleware/auth.ts:6-12`
- `src/routes/users.ts:16-18`
- `src/routes/products.ts:15-17`

# Express App

## Goal

Initialize and configure the Express application, setting up middleware chain and route mounting.

## Contract

| Provides | Expects |
|----------|---------|
| HTTP server on port 3000 | Valid route handlers |
| JSON body parsing | Valid JSON in request bodies |
| Middleware chain execution | Middleware calls `next()` |

## Implementation

```typescript
const app = express();

app.use(express.json());      // JSON body parsing
app.use(authMiddleware);      // Authentication gate

app.use('/users', usersRouter);
app.use('/products', productsRouter);

app.listen(3000);
```

## Edge Cases

| Scenario | Behavior |
|----------|----------|
| Invalid JSON body | Express returns 400 Bad Request |
| Unhandled route | Express returns 404 |
| Middleware rejects | Request stops, error response sent |

## Dependencies

| Component | Relationship |
|-----------|--------------|
| c3-102 Auth Middleware | Applied to all routes |
| c3-103 Users Router | Mounted at `/users` |
| c3-104 Products Router | Mounted at `/products` |

## Testing

| Scenario | Expectation |
|----------|-------------|
| Server starts | Logs "running on port 3000" |
| Valid request | Passes through middleware chain |
| Invalid JSON | Returns 400 |

## Source Files

- `src/index.ts`

# Auth Middleware

## Goal

Validate authentication tokens on all incoming requests before they reach route handlers.

## Contract

| Provides | Expects |
|----------|---------|
| Request authentication gate | `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header |
| Early rejection of unauthenticated requests | Token not equal to "invalid" |
| Pass-through for valid tokens | Express middleware signature |

## Implementation

```typescript
export function authMiddleware(req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
  const token = req.headers.authorization?.replace('Bearer ', '');

  if (!token) {
    return res.status(401).json({ error: 'No token provided' });
  }

  if (token === 'invalid') {
    return res.status(401).json({ error: 'Invalid token' });
  }

  next();
}
```

## Edge Cases

| Scenario | Behavior |
|----------|----------|
| Missing Authorization header | 401 "No token provided" |
| Token equals "invalid" | 401 "Invalid token" |
| Any other token | Request proceeds |
| Malformed header (no "Bearer ") | Token extracted as-is |

## Used By

| Component | Context |
|-----------|---------|
| c3-101 Express App | Applied globally to all routes |

## Conventions Applied

| Convention | How |
|------------|-----|
| c3-105 Error Handling | Returns `{ error: message }` format |

## Testing

| Scenario | Expectation |
|----------|-------------|
| No auth header | 401 with error message |
| `Bearer invalid` | 401 with error message |
| `Bearer anytoken` | Next middleware called |

## Source Files

- `src/middleware/auth.ts`

# Users Router

## Goal

Provide RESTful endpoints for managing user data (list, get, create).

## Uses

| Category | Component | For |
|----------|-----------|-----|
| Foundation | c3-102 Auth Middleware | All routes require authentication |
| Auxiliary | c3-105 Error Handling | 404 responses |
| Auxiliary | c3-106 Route Pattern | RESTful structure |

## Behavior

| Trigger | Result |
|---------|--------|
| `GET /users` | Returns array of all users |
| `GET /users/:id` | Returns single user or 404 |
| `POST /users` | Creates user, returns 201 |

## Data Model

```typescript
interface User {
  id: number;
  name: string;
  email: string;
}
```

## Storage

In-memory array (non-persistent):
```typescript
const users = [
  { id: 1, name: 'Alice', email: 'alice@example.com' },
  { id: 2, name: 'Bob', email: 'bob@example.com' },
];
```

## Endpoints

| Method | Path | Request | Response |
|--------|------|---------|----------|
| GET | `/users` | - | `User[]` |
| GET | `/users/:id` | - | `User` or 404 |
| POST | `/users` | `{ name, email }` | `User` (201) |

## Testing

| Scenario | Expectation |
|----------|-------------|
| GET /users | Returns all seeded users |
| GET /users/1 | Returns Alice |
| GET /users/999 | Returns 404 |
| POST /users with body | Creates and returns new user |

## Source Files

- `src/routes/users.ts`

# C3 Architecture Documentation Adoption

## Overview

```mermaid
graph TD
    ADR[This ADR] -->|establishes| C3[C3 Structure]
    C3 -->|contains| CTX[c3-0 Context]
    CTX -->|contains| CON[Containers]
    CON -->|contains| CMP[Components]
```

## Status

**Implemented** - 2026-01-12

## Problem

| Situation | Impact |
|-----------|--------|
| No architecture docs | Onboarding takes weeks |
| Knowledge in heads | Bus factor risk |
| Ad-hoc decisions | Inconsistent patterns |

## Decision Drivers

- Need for consistent API development patterns
- Single-developer project growing in complexity
- Future team onboarding considerations

## Decision

Adopt C3 (Context-Container-Component) methodology for architecture documentation.

## Structure Created

| Level | ID | Name | Purpose |
|-------|-----|------|---------|
| Context | c3-0 | Simple Shop API | System overview |
| Container | c3-1 | API Server | Express.js REST API |

## Rationale

| Consideration | C3 Approach |
|---------------|-------------|
| Layered abstraction | Context → Container → Component |
| Change isolation | Strategic vs tactical separation |
| Growth-ready | Structure exists before content |
| Decision tracking | ADRs capture evolution |

## Consequences

### Positive

- Architecture visible and navigable
- Onboarding accelerated
- Decisions documented with reasoning

### Negative

- Maintenance overhead (docs can drift)
- Initial time investment

## Verification

- [x] `.c3/README.md` exists (c3-0)
- [x] All containers have `README.md`
- [x] Diagrams use consistent IDs
- [x] Linkages have reasoning

## Problem

| Situation | Impact |
|-----------|--------|
| No architecture docs | Onboarding takes weeks |
| Knowledge in heads | Bus factor risk |
| Ad-hoc decisions | Inconsistent patterns |

## Decision Drivers

- Need for consistent API development patterns
- Single-developer project growing in complexity
- Future team onboarding considerations

## Decision

Adopt C3 (Context-Container-Component) methodology for architecture documentation.

## Structure Created

| Level | ID | Name | Purpose |
|-------|-----|------|---------|
| Context | c3-0 | Simple Shop API | System overview |
| Container | c3-1 | API Server | Express.js REST API |

## Rationale

| Consideration | C3 Approach |
|---------------|-------------|
| Layered abstraction | Context → Container → Component |
| Change isolation | Strategic vs tactical separation |
| Growth-ready | Structure exists before content |
| Decision tracking | ADRs capture evolution |

## Consequences

### Positive

- Architecture visible and navigable
- Onboarding accelerated
- Decisions documented with reasoning

### Negative

- Maintenance overhead (docs can drift)
- Initial time investment
